noun.description: A relationship in which a person, thing, or idea is linked or associated with something else.
examples: the connections between social attitudes and productivity
sufferers deny that their problems have any connection with drugs
she introduced Jean to a number of her male drug connections

phrases: detectives are questioning two men in connection with alleged criminal damage
He had been appearing for a remand in custody hearing in connection with two burglaries.
Three people have been questioned by police in connection with the demonstration.
Two local youths have been arrested and questioned by officers in connection with the incident.
That was the third time I had to phone the council last month, all in connection with our recycling box.
origin: Late Middle English: from Latin connexio(n-), from connectere (see connect). The spelling -ct (18th century) is from connect, on the pattern of pairs such as collect, collection.
